attributes.action: Demand MPs to hold an anonymous poll on the EU Referendum (Stay/Leave)
attributes.background: MPs need to have their say on the EU Referendum led by their conscience to do the best for Britain. First, it is better to hold an anonymous poll so that MPs are not influenced by career ambitions of being re-elected (support their electoral area outcome even if they are fundamentally against it).
attributes.additional_details:
The EU Referendum had an advisory role. The outcome was compromised by misleading information from the Leave campaign, topics included: NHS, immigration, free movement and the cost of the UK’s EU membership. Millions of people didn't know what they voted for. 
This anonymous poll is designed to help MPs understand where they stand and proceed accordingly as the period of uncertainty is unquestionably bad for the economy.
MPs are required to vote in Britain's best interest by law.

attributes.action: Create a specific offence to protect Nurses, Paramedics & Medical volunteers.
attributes.background:
This offence should be created to enable prosecution for anyone who assaults Medical Staff. This offence can be committed anywhere medical personnel are working. This must be extended to not only to NHS trusts, but also voluntary organisations and private providers.

Medical Staff are life-savers
attributes.additional_details:
Paramedics have threatened with death, spat at, kicked, punched and had knives pulled on them as they answer emergency calls.

Ambulance trust’s are now calling on magistrates to get tough with offenders convicted of assaulting 999 teams, to protect frontline medics from violence and abuse.

There is no deterrent. If people knew they would get a guaranteed prison sentence for attacking medical staff, they would probably think twice about doing it.

attributes.action: Require Coroners, in suicide cases, to explore if best practice was followed.
attributes.background: Worldwide studies show that the involvement of family, friends & carers helps to reduce suicide. The document, http://bit.ly/1VUKDI5, agreed by all the professional bodies, advocates that unless there are good reasons not to do so, consent should always be sought to involve family, friends & carers.
attributes.additional_details: Rebecca Kelsall, see http://dailym.ai/1UWGJNx, died because GPs failed to follow RCGP guidelines CR152 and the NICE guidelines CG90 and CG91. This showed that the health service can be slow in keeping abreast with latest guidelines. As coroners have a duty to investigate whether death was avoidable, they are best placed to monitor whether best practice guidelines are followed.  As such, coroners should persistently ask clinicians and others for reports about processes and procedures followed.

attributes.action: Reduce the women's retirement age back to 60.
attributes.background: Women work hard within the workplace and having to work many extra hours at home.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for doctors to send males letters about a PSA BLOOD TEST
attributes.background: I want action as i find women get reminders to have regular smear tests done but males who are reaching the age of 50 have to ask to have a psa test done to check for prostate cancer and not alot of men know about this test

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on key Brexit deals BEFORE giving Article 50 notice
attributes.background: There is no democracy without informed consent. Voters did not know before 23 June the terms on which we would leave the EU, the global trade deals which would be done or our immigration policy following Brexit. These must be agreed and voted on BEFORE we give irrevocable Art 50 notice to leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Article 50 is a one way street.  Once it gives one, that state must leave the EU after 2 years (or more if the remaining 27 agree).  We do not need to give notice until we KNOW that the terms we would have (both with the EU and the rest of the world) would be better outside than inside the EU.

We should promptly negotiate with the EU and others and put these deals to the electorate.  Only if the electorate votes in favour should we leave.  A statute should stop notice being given otherwise.

attributes.action: Prevent any Council setting up charges for Park Run or any similar event.
attributes.background: Little Stoke Parish Council have begun to charge runners £1 to participate in its local Park Run. An event which helps and encourages people to get out and run or walk 5km once a week.
attributes.additional_details: Park Run is a free global organised run and should be kept that way.

attributes.action: Make the documents relating to David Kelly's death public
attributes.background:
David Kelly's death, a UN weapons inspector, shortly followed the WMD inspections in 2003. In 2010, the government deemed the circumstances around his death 'should be kept secret' for 70 years.
Following the Chilcot report today, I feel these documents should be released in the public interest.

attributes.action: Get Pam Carlson's Deportation OVERTURNED!
attributes.background: Pam has lived in the UK for 7 YEARS, she came over on a Domestic Visa, but split from her long term partner, therefore being deported. She works, lives and contributes to this country as well as being an avid fund raiser for animal charities. She does nothing but GIVE, never taken a penny from theUK
attributes.additional_details: What more information do you need, other than she works, lives, and has a LIFE here in the UK. She fund raises, she helps others, and she is one of the nicest people anyone has ever known.

attributes.action: To create awareness and delvelop treatment on Temporomandibular Joint disorders
attributes.background:
The symptoms of TMJD include facial pain, reduced mouth opening and headaches which can be very debilitating. 

PURPOSE: 
- patients need to know which treatments they can access 
- to create more TMJD centers on the NHS in all regions of the UK, not just London
- more research into TMJD.
attributes.additional_details: TMJD affects approx. 25% of the population. There are very few NHS clinics which provide TMJD treatment in the UK compared to the USA even though there are NICE Guidelines set out for TMJD, most patients who do not know that treatment is available.

attributes.action: Bring an end to zero hour contracts!
attributes.background: Zero hour contracts make it hard for people to save and budget. This can cause a host to many detrimental effects! Under a zero hour contract an employer has no obligation to provide any minimum hours of work leaving employees with worry that they may not be able to feed their family or pay bills.
attributes.additional_details:
Zero hour contracts make it hard for people to save and budget. This can cause a host to many detrimental effects! Under a zero hour contract an employer has no obligation to provide any minimum hours of work leaving employees with worry that they may not be able to feed their family or pay bills on time. 
I would like Parliament to discuss bringing a minimum guaranteed hours scheme or a base pay so people don't have to rely on benefits to see them through.

attributes.action: Introduce Land Tax or similar reform so super rich can't avoid Inheritance Tax
attributes.background:
PM Mrs May said in her first speech "When it comes to taxes, we’ll prioritise not the wealthy, but you." The new Duke of Westminster, using family trusts, just avoided paying £3.6 BILLION Inheritance Tax.

Land Tax can't be avoided so no one can avoid paying their fair share. Let's make it happen!
attributes.additional_details:
Duke of Westminster avoids billions in inheritance tax:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/tax/inheritance/inheritance-tax-and-how-the-dukes-of-westminster-avoid-it-on-the/

About Land Tax: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/aug/15/queen-duke-westminster-land-value-tax-distribute-wealth-super-rich

The avoided Inheritance Tax could fund the NHS deficit (£2.45 billion) with a billion pounds to spare:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/20/nhs-in-england-reveals-245bn-record-deficit

attributes.action: KS2 Reading SATs was unfair on pupils & shouldn’t be counted in performance data
attributes.background: Unlike other Key Stage 2 subjects, the Reading paper differed significantly from the sample test. We fully support a drive to increase standards, but the level of vocabulary was above beyond most 11 year olds. This poor communication of expectations by the DfE should not punish pupils or schools.
attributes.additional_details: The number of inferential questions was far higher, with fewer literal, than the sample. Both were inaccessible to lower attainers, who couldn’t show skills learned. In past/sample tests pupils found key words in a question to retrieve information/infer answers. This test required pupils find synonyms of key words. Teachers would have taught this had it been indicated in sample materials/Programme of Study. It’s unfair to test children on skills for which there was no indication to teachers.

attributes.action: Call a general election immediately after Conservative party leadership decided
attributes.background: Labour & Conservatives contested the 2015 General Election with policies based on continuing EU membership.David Cameron has now resigned.The political landscape is now changed.Parties must devise new manifestos based on EU exit & transition & put to the electorate to decide who leads us through it.

attributes.action: Veterans injury compensation to be protected and disregarded for benefits!!
attributes.background:
If a veteran recieves compensation as a result of an injury caused whilst serving our country - i believe it should be protected and disregarded for benefit entitlement.
Recieving compensation shouldn't effect a veteran claiming benefits inc ESA, JSA and housing when they return to civilian life.
attributes.additional_details:
At present compensation is classed as savings. If a veteran recieves over £6,000, their entitlement to benefit may be affected  (reduced). If a veteran recieves more than £16,000 then they may not be entitled to the benefit at all. 

Veterans should be able to choose how they use their compensaton, and not be turned away for benefits and expected to live off it!

Help protect our veterans and their compensaton by signing my petition in support, thankyou :)

attributes.action: Ask UK Government to Guarantee the UK membership to the European Research Area.
attributes.background: British Universities in particular benefit from participation in European projects. Access to grants and colleagues from across the EU is vital to our universities and our science. We get out more than we put in. Why lose it?
attributes.additional_details:
UK universities in particular benefit hugely from participation in pan European projects and need reassurance from the Government that will continue. Access to the European Research Area is vital to British science and future generations. A recent parliamentary report strongly backed this position. In the future it could be possible for British business to benefit in the same way as universities. 
 
http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/ld201516/ldselect/ldsctech/127/127.pdf

attributes.action: Change UK Immigration Policy so that families like the Brains may reside here.
attributes.background: The Brain Family in Dingwall moved over from Australia under a visa programme that was subsequently revoked without any exceptions being made for them.  After much publicity and support from their MP and the First Minister of Scotland, their stay has been extended but are prohibited from employment.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Government policy on immigration should be changed to take due account of the following:

-     Where people have resettled here at considerable personal expense under a previous immigration programme.

-      Whether people come from Commonwealth countries where the Queen is Head of State.

-      The opinions and recommendations of their local elected representatives and of the Leader of the democratically-elected devolved Government should carry an appropriate level of weighting by UK Gov.

attributes.action: Allow PTSD companion dogs to be classed as assistance dogs.
attributes.background: It has been proven that dogs have assisted those suffering from mental health issues. The prime example is that in the USA dogs for military veterans suffering PTSD, have enabled the individual. The fact that this proven and recognized assistance is not recognized here in the UK needs to be changed.
attributes.additional_details:
http://journalofethics.ama-assn.org/2015/06/hlaw1-1506.html

http://www.apadivisions.org/division-19/publications/newsletters/military/2015/04/service-dogs.aspx

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/how-dogs-can-help-veterans-overcome-ptsd-137582968/?no-ist

attributes.action: Provide protection for closed railway track-beds to aid rural regeneration.
attributes.background: In the mid -1960's Dr Beeching was employed to find ways of making the railways more profitable and his report resulted in the closure of a large part of our railway network. The report failed to take into account the growth in population and the necessity for rural transport.
attributes.additional_details: The railways were mainly built under Act of Parliament. After closure Local Authorities have sold off railway land for development. Usage for footpaths and cycleways is fine. Building houses and industrial estates prevent regeneration of these railways. Scotrail have reopened part of the old Waverley route. Groups would like to reopen lines such as the Somerset, Dorset, Deeside line, Lynton & Barnstable and Matlock, Bakewell & Buxton and Cliffe Hill Mineral Railway. Local authorites should be required to aid projects and reject planning for developments.

attributes.action: Monitoring in pregnancy for every woman who has received cervical treatments
attributes.background:
Myself & my fiancé lost our beautiful baby boy, Oscar, after he was born prematurely at 24 weeks. 
My waters broke due to an incompetent cervix that was never checked or monitored despite having part of my cervix removed after a Lletz procedure.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount of cells that were removed from my cervix were classified as low risk and therefore no further monitoring or checks were made during pregnancy. Had I been monitored my incompetent cervix would have been diagnosed and our perfect son may be here today. 
I am petitioning for every pregnant woman who has undergone any type of treatment compromising their cervix to be monitored during their pregnancy to prevent baby losses like ours occurring in the future.

attributes.action: Give grandparents the right to see their grandchildren.
attributes.background: I have not seen my grandchildren in over 3 years. Currently there is no law in place which allows grandparents to see their grandchildren. There should be a law in which we should see them regardless  of relations between the sets of parents.  there are 'no winners' with the current law.
attributes.additional_details: My daughter got a new partner and for some unknown reason he did not like us seeing our grandchildren. They have recently moved away and we now have absolutely no way of contacting or seeing our grandchildren.

attributes.action: Keep the ban on neonics to protect the bees!
attributes.background: Despite the fact that bee-endangering pesticides are banned in the EU, the UK government just gave the go-ahead to farmers to sow these toxic-coated seeds anyway. Any day now, Bayer and Syngenta's toxic bee-harming seeds could be sown.
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of listening to us, the Government listened to the intensive farming industry - ignoring the growing evidence of how dangerous these chemicals are to bees and other pollinators.

Hundreds of thousands of people have already signed other petitions to the UK Government to stop harming our bees, and they're feeling the sting. A massive public outcry could force the government to back down and protect bees.

attributes.action: Remove rail franchise from Southeastern (Govia Ltd)
attributes.background: Southeastern provide a consistent poor service to their customers, causing genuine misery and despair to thousands of commuters in the South East. They put profit before customers and effect the daily lives of people who just want to get to work on time and in comfort. No more debating, take action!

attributes.action: Stop Sodexo from closing Katie's Kitchen
attributes.background: Katie's kitchen is a food van that his been running for over 20 years and now is being shut down by the greed of Sodexo. Katie's kitchen has given joy to surviving soldiers for many many years by coming out on exercise and saving the troops from the rotting stomach of ration packs
attributes.additional_details: Sodexo food is over priced and under quality. They will double the price of Katie's kitchen and they don't want any competition

attributes.action: Don't leave the EU without guarantees of Vote Leave's promises
attributes.background:
The Vote Leave campaign said the UK could have: 1. £350 million a week back from the EU, for spending on the NHS, 2. Control of migration policy, and 3. Continued access to the single market.
We call on HM Government not to leave the EU without cast-iron guarantees to meet these three key pledges.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that leaders must be accountable, and that promises to voters matter. If and when HM Government invokes Article 50, the UK will have to leave the EU within two years, even if it cannot get a good deal. Any EU country could prevent the UK joining again. We call on HM Government not to leave the EU, and not to invoke article 50, without guarantees that these Vote Leave pledges will be met.

attributes.action: Stop police from passing animal abuse cases to RSPCA for a private prosecution.
attributes.background: This petition is set up to stop UK police forces from passing potential animal abuse cases to the RSPCA for a private prosecution. We strongly believe that if somebody has abused or caused unnecessary suffering to an animal, which is a criminal offence under the animal welfare act 2006,
attributes.additional_details: The police should deal with the case. Such as they do with any other breach of the law. The case should not be passed over to a private charity and become a private case in the eyes of the law.  In recent years there have been many cases were members of the public have had wrongful attempted prosecutions brought upon them. For example, Bob Skinner & Mr Pig in 2015. We believe it is in the best interest of the animals and the public that cases of animal abuse are dealt with by the police from start to finish. Once the case has passed into private hands, what is right and wrong becomes subjective and the lines of the law become blurred, and opinions start to overrule the facts.

attributes.action: Official EU Referendum RESULT of LEAVE announced 24TH JUNE 2016 must be CARRIED.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to ENFORCE THE WILL OF THE PEOPLE as decided in the free and democratic EU REFERENDUM VOTE ON 23RD JUNE 2016 and as stated by Prime Minister David Cameron that the Brexit vote was the "will of the British people" and an "instruction which must be delivered"
attributes.additional_details:
Prime Minister demonstrated his FULL ACCEPTANCE of the result of the EU Referendum on 23rd June 2016, stating that the will of the British people on THAT vote was an instruction that MUST be delivered. This followed his resignation to the Queen, and later to his Government and The Country. 

This EU Referendum gained more votes in total than any General Election in UK history, the LEAVE RESULT also gained more votes than any political party taking office post a General Election. RESULT TO STAND.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum should cannabis be legalized.
attributes.background: Cannabis has been used as medicine for thousands of years let the people decide if we should have access to this medicine in a regulated way or not.

attributes.action: Stop the M56 new junction 11a scheme.
attributes.background: Highways England are planning to introduce a M56 junction 11a. The plans squeeze a new junction between 2 existing junctions that are no more than 4 miles apart. No evidence has been offered by Highways England to justify it's need or cost. It would have a severe impact on several local communities.
attributes.additional_details: Having reviewed the existing plans many residents are sceptical about the motive for this junction. They believe that the new junction would only serve to channel traffic towards a new Mersey Toll Bridge crossing (currently under construction) and will do nothing to ease the serious congestion issues that already exist between Junction 12 and 14.

attributes.action: Educate all health professionals and teachers on Autism!!
attributes.background: Autism is a condition that not many people are aware of unless they have experience of it, as a result people with this condition are becoming more socially excluded in everyday life. People with the condition face constant battles and are misunderstood and judged due to the lack of education.

attributes.action: No longer allow letting agents to discriminate against 'dss'
attributes.background: I am disabled due to a stroke and receive housing Benefits to top up the wage I earn.  Letting agents are allowed to discriminate against this, regardless of circumstance. It harks back to the time when people were allowed to discriminate against skin colour and nationality.
attributes.additional_details: Where your funds come from should make no difference, housing benefit can be more reliable than wages in that you can't be fired! I have rented receiving benefits as a single person, a single mother, part of a couple and now as a disabled parent. I have always been discriminated against. Let's make this change and not victimise the most vulnerable of our society. Let's not be those people.

attributes.action: Launch an Independent Inquiry into Hunt's Junior Doctor contract & 7day NHS plan
attributes.background: The Health Secretary has misrepresented data to claim a non-existent weekend mortality effect. The Public Accounts committee says his 7-day NHS plan is unfunded. His proposed contract has alienated a generation of doctors. We demand an Independent Inquiry into Hunt's actions and their consequences.
attributes.additional_details:
Public Accounts Committee report: http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-a-z/commons-select/public-accounts-committee/news-parliament-2015/nhs-staff-numbers-report-published-15-16/

Studies demonstrate Hunt's purported weekend effect - the basis for imposing his Junior Doctor contract - does not exist: http://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/06/fewer-die-in-hospital-weekends-study-jeremy-hunt-doctors-contract

attributes.action: End gvt. contracts to companies which avoid UK tax, or advise on tax avoidance
attributes.background: Many large corporations are benefitting from huge government contracts, grants & subsidies while avoiding corporation tax in the UK. The law should prevent the award of government contracts or funds to companies that do not pay tax on ALL their UK income, or to companies that advise on tax avoidance
attributes.additional_details: Many companies - including those running publicly-funded services - do not pay tax on the money they make in the UK, though their businesses & employees depend on the services & infrastructure paid for by UK taxpayers. Meanwhile large accountancy & management consultancy firms benefit from lucrative government contracts while also advising clients on how to avoid paying tax. Public money - grants subsidies & contracts - should not be awarded to tax-avoiding companies or those advising them.

attributes.action: Make the BBC declare an interest when broadcasting on the EU referendum.
attributes.background: When directors of companies or MP's are involved in decision making where they have any financial or commercial interest, they are duty bound to declare that interest. The BBC coverage of the EU referendum  can be seen as biased as they receive a grant from the EU.
attributes.additional_details: BBC has received £2m in EU funding in run up to referendum, fuelling accusations of bias. (source Daily Telegraph)

attributes.action: Reform the IR35 Tax Regulations introduced in 2000.
attributes.background: The IR35 Regulations, introduced in 2000 to address the differences in liabilities due to HMRC between an employee and a self-employed freelance contractor providing services under a limited company, is a highly subjective, unclear and disproportionate piece of legislation that should be amended.
attributes.additional_details:
Specific reforms sought are:

Absolute clarity for a contractor of his/her IR35 status prior to a contract being signed so that appropriate rates can be negotiated.

Within IR35 status calculations:

Have sufficient allowances for expenses, particularly for travelling freelance contractors (rather than just 5% currently).

Exempt ENICs from the IR35 calculations, as regular employees do not pay ENICs.

Build sufficient allowances into the calculations to recognise a lack of employee benefits.

attributes.action: Review the work of the Lowcost Holidays travel company bankruptcy scandal
attributes.background: Lowcost Holidays has gone into administration owing thousands of pounds to over 110,000 UK customers also without a holiday many of which were booked months in advance. Lowcost Holidays used to be ATOL and ABTA protected but moved to Majorca at the end of 2013.
attributes.additional_details: The practice of travel companies not paying for hotel accommodation/flights/transfers after they've been paid by customers should be made illegal. It's a company based within the EU but there is little or no EU protection for its citizens against this poor practice or when a travel company goes into administration. Why?

attributes.action: Allow citizens to raise concerns about behaviour of MPs during Commons' Debates
attributes.background: MPs may raise Points of Order during House of Commons’ debates if they think that an MP has said something offensive or inappropriate. There is no way for members of the public to do this. Members of the public should be able to raise matters of concern with the Speaker, for reporting to the House.
attributes.additional_details: For instance, it was customary for the Speaker to report to the House the conviction of a member by a criminal court even if the sentence did not disqualify them from remaining a member of the House (an example being Mr. Saklatvala in 1926).

attributes.action: Change the prejudiced welfare system - Keep families together!
attributes.background: The welfare system does not grant enough rights to families to care for grandchildren. It is too prejudiced.  They are far too eager to take babies away for adoption. We need reform in the current system please.
attributes.additional_details: I can provide references which a personal to me but also which I am absolutely positive that other families out there will be in the same position to provide.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to send the brightest and best international students home
attributes.background: New Immigration Rules (HC877) require students to return home if they secure a work placement year or perform better than expected and are upgraded (e.g. BEng to MEng). This is penalising the brightest and best, it is unfair and damages the UK's reputation. This decision should be reversed.
attributes.additional_details:
On 08/04/2016, the UK Council for International Student Affairs received the following:
"A student who needs more time to complete a course can only apply for further leave to do this if they meet one of the exemptions set out in 120A(a).  A student who undertakes a work placement would be changing their course and would therefore need to apply from overseas if they wanted to extend their leave to complete their (new) course."
The explanatory memorandum to HC877 does not detail this consequence.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for horse riders to take their horses on public roads
attributes.background: To prevent the death and well-being of horses on public roads. To reduce road rage between motorists and horse riders. Horses being on the road causes traffic which causes more accidents and road rage. When a horse deficates, this can become a hazard for motorists as it makes the road slippy.

attributes.action: Call for Parliament to end tax-free status for ALL religious organisations in UK
attributes.background: Religion, whether you believe in it or not, is a business. It always has, and always will be. In 2013 the Church of England's revenue was £1.41 billion; taxed at just 5% would have generated £70,000,000! This is ONE religion in ONE year..! If there is a God, wouldn't he want to help our country...?
attributes.additional_details: As somebody who is fundamentally non-religious, I have always been amazed at the tax-free statuses of religious organisations. Even if God IS real, why should his representatives not pay tax? Their reason: They provide crucial social services, and that 200 years of church tax exemptions have not turned us into a theocracy. Taxing religious organisations won't make us a theocracy, especially if they're ALL taxed. Hospitals also provide social service, they're taxed; so why not religions..?

attributes.action: Legalise holistic/complementary/alternative/therapeutic use of herbal cannabis.
attributes.background: Complementary/Alternative medicine is any practice that is put forward as having the healing effects of medicine in a belief not confirmed using the scientific method, and used together with conventional medicine it "complements" (improves the efficacy of) the treatment.Its use is evidence based.
attributes.additional_details: Herbal cannabis is used around the world as an alternative therapy and has been for millenia.In ancient times its versatility/low toxicity turned cannabis into the remedy of choice for common ailments of the masses.Its properties complement the efficacy of traditional Western Medicine.Intractable pain/MS/MND/insomnia/anti-cancer/anti-inflammatory/anti-nausea/anti-emetic/sedative/anti-anxiety/mood enhancer/antidepressant/appetite stimulant/dyspepsia/antispasmodic/anticonvulsant/bronchodilator.

attributes.action: Control the population of seabirds for health, safety and environmental reasons
attributes.background: The Scarborough News is campaigning for a change in the law to manage the populations of seabirds including kittiwakes in the interest of public safety, health and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of control over the seabird population has led to dangerous food-grabbing swoops on men, women and children, and the creation of a serious scale of mess and stench of droppings in shopping areas, and on pavements, shop buildings and the general environment.

attributes.action: To get the NHS to give cancer patients full body screening yearly
attributes.background: I would like the NHS change the way the NHS screen for cancer. I have lost Family members to cancer including my Dad. I myself am living with cancer and it scares me to death for myself and my 7 year old daughter who needs me here to be her mum. I want full screening every year for cancer patients.
attributes.additional_details: In my experience cancer does come back  and quite often in a different area. This is why I feel it is important for all past and present cancer patients to receive a full body screening every year. I had a ovarian tumour removed in 2012 now in 2016 I have bowel cancer, I did receive yearly bloods targeted in pelvic area and the bowel cancer wasn't found. I feel by having full body screening yearly could save more lives, and less invasive treatment.

attributes.action: I do not believe we really need or want to have drones delivering parcels
attributes.background: Amazon and the government are about to conduct trials using drones to deliver parcels to their customers. Where Amazon go others will follow. Should we sacrifice the peace and quiet of the air for the benefit of a few and the profit of big corporations. Lets leave the sky above for the birds.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/video_and_audio/headlines/36887326
The talk is all about safety and not whether the public want or need such a service.

attributes.action: change the law for sentences that reflect in loss of life to a family dog.
attributes.background: Our family dog was recently run over by a speeding motorbike. Our dog was on a lead and this only happened because the rider of the bike was speeding. The law classes dogs as a possession so the rider of the bike can not be sentenced for killing our dog.
attributes.additional_details:
Our dog was part of the family as i'm sure most dogs are. If someone runs a dog over and they are at fault then I believe they should be senented for killing the dog, what if next time it's a child? 
The law classes dog's as property like a T.V. if your T.V breaks you relace it, you can't just replace a dog with another as they become part of the family.

attributes.action: Increase the number of Police Constables and Increase Police Constables Pay
attributes.background: The number of Police officers continue to drop every year down to 207,140 as of March 31st 2015. More and more harsh cuts effect the safety of everyone, leave Police forces stretched and workload too high for each officer. Pay for officers is also too low and only getting 1% is a slap in the face.
attributes.additional_details: Government reports show the downward spiral in numbers. An offer of just 1% pay rise is just not acceptable, for the hard work, long hours and low pay that our officers have to put in. Especially in a modern environment filled with danger, our officers put their lives on the line, every day that they report for duty. They are not permitted to industrial strike action and have little in the way of representation. The people of the U.K. Now need to show our officers that we support them.

attributes.action: Ban fire works restrict sales to 48 hours prior to bonfire night
attributes.background:
Ban the sale of fire works until 48 hours prior to an event, create a new law to controll fireworks the current noise and curfews do nothong 
Animal cruelty should should be a number one concern
attributes.additional_details: Just Google the effect on animals it's all there

attributes.action: Stop HS2 destroying our villages in Barnburgh and Harlington. No to HS2
attributes.background: HS2 wants to run a high speed train through Mexborough, destroying homes, & Barnburgh and Harlington, destroying countryside. If it gets the go-ahead 18 trains per hour - running 5am until midnight - will pass through our town/villages. Sign this petition to say NO to HS2 destroying our area.

attributes.action: Ban the practice of 'crossing the floor' by an elected member of parliament.
attributes.background: The practice of 'crossing the floor' in Parliament is dishonest and is a betrayal of the constituents who voted for a particular MP. If an MP wishes to either join a different party or form a new one he should announce his intention and immediately resign his seat in order to stand in a by-election.
